column4: have a problem with ubuntu , when I choose ubuntu from booting list , the loading logo doesnt show , just the login screen , any ideas?
I dont have this problem @ this current pc , but on the laptop because I have vista installed it
I dont understand the problem. Vista is unrelated to Ubuntu boot logo - unless you mean that by installing Vista you no longer have the option to boot Ubuntu.
No , I mean I had Ubuntu Loading logo working fine , but after installing vista , the Loading logo doesnt work
that is very strange indeed. I would be surprised if Vista have modified your BIOS/CMOS settings. anyway, you can try to set the framebuffer resolution (by force it) in the page ubotu said.
no idea. where do you see that?
im in the Bios menu right now
I haven't encountered that option in any of the BIOS settings I've seen.
unless it's the screen just before boot that list IRQ and connected devices just before Win/DOS  boots
there's usually a help screen in the BIOS settings though that should explain it.
the guide only shows how to disable the frame buffer
no, it also show how to enter a framebuffer resolution in GRUB.

turn off the framebuffer. you will see text scroll by instead of the bar. see if you get any error messages or see which service is slow to start. if everything looks ok, set the frame buffer resolution in GRUB as in the link I advised earlier.
I have disabled the frame buffer but nothing is showing up
